info.title: Outline API
info.description:
# Introduction

The Outline API is structured in an RPC style. It enables you to
programatically interact with all aspects of Outline’s data – in fact, the
main application is built on exactly the same API.

The API structure is available as an
[openapi specification](https://github.com/outline/openapi) if that’s your
jam – it can be used to generate clients for most programming languages.

# Making requests

Outline’s API follows simple RPC style conventions where each API endpoint is
a `POST` method on `https://app.getoutline.com/api/:method`. Only HTTPS is
supported and all response payloads are JSON.

When making `POST` requests, request parameters are parsed depending on
Content-Type header. To make a call using JSON payload, you must pass
Content-Type: application/json header, here’s an example using CURL:

```
curl https://app.getoutline.com/api/documents.info \
-X 'POST' \
-H 'authorization: Bearer MY_API_KEY' \
-H 'content-type: application/json' \
-H 'accept: application/json' \
-d '{"id": "outline-api-NTpezNwhUP"}'
```

Or, with JavaScript:

```javascript
const response = await fetch("https://app.getoutline.com/api/documents.info", {
  method: "POST",
  headers: {
    Accept: "application/json",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    Authorization: "Bearer MY_API_KEY"
  }
})

const body = await response.json();
const document = body.data;
```

# Authentication

## API key

You can create new API keys under **Settings => API & Apps**. Be
careful when handling your keys as they allow full access to your data,
you should treat them like passwords and they should never be committed to
source control.

### Usage

To authenticate with API, you should supply the API key as a "Bearer" token in the `Authorization` header
(`Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY`).

API keys can be revoked at any time by the creating user or an administrator of the workspace. If an API
key is revoked, any requests made with that key will return a `401 Unauthenticated` response.

### Format

All API keys always begin with `ol_api_` followed by a random string of 38 letters and numbers.

## OAuth 2.0

OAuth 2.0 is a widely used protocol for authorization and authentication. It allows users
to grant third-party _or_ internal applications access to their resources without sharing
their credentials. To use OAuth 2.0 you need to follow these steps:

1. Register your application under **Settings => Applications**
2. Obtain an access token by exchanging the client credentials for an access token
3. Use the access token to authenticate requests to the API

Some API endpoints allow unauthenticated requests for public resources and
they can be called without authentication.

# Scopes

Scopes are used to limit the access of an API key or application to specific resources. For example,
an application may only need access to read documents, but not write them. Scopes can be global in
the case of `read` and `write` scopes, scoped to a namespace, scoped to an API endpoint, or use
wildcard scopes like `documents.*`. Some examples of scopes that can be used are:

## Global

- `read`: Allows all read actions
- `write`: Allows all read and write actions

## Namespaced

- `documents:read`: Allows all document read actions
- `collections:write`: Allows all collection write actions

## Endpoints

- `documents.info`: Allows only one specific API method
- `documents.*`: Allows all document API methods
- `users.*`: Allows all user API methods

# Errors

All successful API requests will be returned with a 200 or 201 status code
and `ok: true` in the response payload. If there’s an error while making the
request, the appropriate status code is returned with the error message:

```
{
  "ok": false,
  "error": "Not Found"
}
```

# Pagination

Most top-level API resources have support for "list" API methods. For instance,
you can list users, documents, and collections. These list methods share
common parameters, taking both `limit` and `offset`.

Responses will echo these parameters in the root `pagination` key, and also
include a `nextPath` key which can be used as a handy shortcut to fetch the
next page of results. For example:

```
{
  ok: true,
  status: 200,
  data: […],
  pagination: {
    limit: 25,
    offset: 0,
    nextPath: "/api/documents.list?limit=25&offset=25"
  }
}
```

# Rate limits

Like most APIs, Outline has rate limits in place to prevent abuse. Endpoints
that mutate data are more restrictive than read-only endpoints. If you exceed
the rate limit for a given endpoint, you will receive a `429 Too Many Requests`
status code.

The response will include a `Retry-After` header that indicates how many seconds
you should wait before making another request.

# Policies

Most API resources have associated "policies", these objects describe the
current authentications authorized actions related to an individual resource. It
should be noted that the policy "id" is identical to the resource it is
related to, policies themselves do not have unique identifiers.

For most usecases of the API, policies can be safely ignored. Calling
unauthorized methods will result in the appropriate response code – these can
be used in an interface to adjust which elements are visible.

tags.name: Attachments
tags.description:
`Attachments` represent a file uploaded to cloud storage. They are created
before the upload happens from the client and store all the meta information
such as file type, size, and location.

tags.name: Auth
tags.description:
`Auth` represents the current API Keys authentication details. It can be
used to check that a token is still valid and load the IDs for the current
user and workspace.

tags.name: Collections
tags.description:
`Collections` represent grouping of documents in the knowledge base, they
offer a way to structure information in a nested hierarchy and a level
at which read and write permissions can be granted to individual users or
groups of users.

tags.name: Comments
tags.description:
`Comments` represent a comment either on a selection of text in a document
or on the document itself.

tags.name: DataAttributes
tags.description:
`DataAttributes` represent custom metadata fields that can be attached to
documents. They allow workspaces to add structured data like status, priority,
or any other custom properties to their documents.

tags.name: Documents
tags.description:
`Documents` are what everything else revolves around. A document represents
a single page of information and always returns the latest version of the
content. Documents are stored in [Markdown](https://spec.commonmark.org/)
formatting.

tags.name: Events
tags.description:
`Events` represent an artifact of an action. Whether it is creating a user,
editing a document, changing permissions, or any other action – an event
is created that can be used as an audit trail or activity stream.

tags.name: FileOperations
tags.description:
`FileOperations` represent background jobs for importing or exporting files.
You can query the file operation to find the state of progress and any
resulting output.

tags.name: Groups
tags.description:
`Groups` represent a list of users that logically belong together, for
example there might be groups for each department in your organization.
Groups can be granted access to collections with read or write permissions.

tags.name: OAuthClients
tags.description:
`OAuthClients` represent OAuth clients that can be used to authenticate
users with third-party services.

tags.name: OAuthAuthentications
tags.description:
`OAuthAuthentications` represent individual scoped authentications between
Outline and an `OAuthClient`.

tags.name: Revisions
tags.description:
`Revisions` represent a snapshot of a document at a point in time. They
are used to keep track of editing and collaboration history – a document
can also be restored to a previous revision if necessary.

tags.name: Shares
tags.description:
`Shares` represent authorization to view a document without being a member
of the workspace. Shares are created in order to give access to documents publicly.
Each user that shares a document will have a unique share object.

tags.name: Stars
tags.description:
`Stars` represent a favorited document or collection in the application sidebar.
Each user has their own collection of starred items.

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
`Users` represent an individual with access to the knowledge base. Users
can be created automatically when signing in with SSO or when a user is
invited via email.

tags.name: Templates
tags.description:
`Templates` represent reusable document templates that can be used as a
starting point when creating new documents. Templates can be scoped to a
specific collection or available workspace-wide.

tags.name: Views
tags.description:
`Views` represent a compressed record of an individual users views of a
document. Individual views are not recorded but a first, last and total
is kept per user.

post.description: Creating an attachment object creates a database record and returns the inputs needed to generate a signed url and upload the file from the client to cloud storage.

documentId.description: Identifier for the associated document, if any.

contentType.description: MIME type of the file attachment.

size.description: Size of the file attachment in bytes.

post.description: Load an attachment from where it is stored based on the id. If the attachment is private then a temporary, signed url with embedded credentials is generated on demand.
Deleting an attachment is permanent. It will not delete references or links to the attachment that may exist in your documents.
Retrieve authentication details for the current API key
Retrieve authentication options
Retrieve the details of a collection by its unique identifier.
Returns the document structure of a collection as a tree of navigation nodes, representing the hierarchy of documents within the collection.
List all collections that the authenticated user has access to.

query.description: If set, will filter the results by collection name.

statusFilter.description: An optional array of statuses to filter by.

post.description: Create a new collection with the specified name, description, icon, color, and permission settings. Collections are used to organize documents.

description.description: A brief description of the collection, markdown supported.
description.example: HR documentation is confidential and should be handled with care.

icon.description: A string that represents an icon in the outline-icons package or an emoji

color.description: A hex color code for the collection icon

sharing.description: Whether public sharing of documents is allowed

post.description: Update an existing collection's properties such as name, description, icon, color, sharing settings, or permission level.

description.description: A brief description of the collection, markdown supported.
description.example: HR documentation is confidential and should be handled with care.

icon.description: A string that represents an icon in the outline-icons package or an emoji

color.description: A hex color code for the collection icon

sharing.description: Whether public sharing of documents is allowed

post.description: This method allows you to add a user membership to the specified collection.

userId.description: Identifier for the user to add to the collection

post.description: This method allows you to remove a user from the specified collection.

userId.description: Identifier for the user to remove from the collection

post.description: This method allows you to list a collections individual memberships. It's important to note that memberships returned from this endpoint do not include group memberships.

post.summary: Add a group to a collection
post.description: This method allows you to give all members in a group access to a collection.
This method allows you to revoke all members in a group access to a collection. Note that members of the group may still retain access through other groups or individual memberships.
This method allows you to list a collections group memberships. This is the list of groups that have been given access to the collection.
Delete a collection and all of its documents. This action can’t be undone so please be careful.

Triggers a bulk export of the collection in markdown format and their attachments. If documents are nested then they will be nested in folders inside the zip file. The endpoint returns a `FileOperation` that can be queried to track the progress of the export and get the url for the final file.

includeAttachments.description: Whether to include attachments in the export.

includePrivate.description: Whether to include private collections in the export.

post.description: Triggers a bulk export of multiple collections and their documents. The endpoint returns a `FileOperation` that can be queried through the fileOperations endpoint to track the progress of the export and get the url for the final file.
Add a comment or reply to a document, either `data` or `text` is required.

text.description: The body of the comment in markdown.

post.description: Retrieve a comment

includeAnchorText.description: Include the document text that the comment is anchored to, if any, in the response.

post.description: Update a comment
Deletes a comment. If the comment is a top-level comment, all its children will be deleted as well.
This method will list all comments matching the given properties.

collectionId.description: Filter to a specific collection

includeAnchorText.description: Include the document text that the comment is anchored to, if any, in the response.

post.description: Retrieve a data attribute by its unique identifier.

id.description: Unique identifier for the data attribute.

post.description: List all data attributes.
Create a new data attribute. Only admins can create data attributes.

description.example: The current status of the document.

pinned.description: Whether the data attribute is pinned to the top of document.

post.description: Update an existing data attribute. Only admins can update data attributes. Note that the dataType cannot be changed after creation.

id.description: Unique identifier for the data attribute.

pinned.description: Whether the data attribute is pinned to the top of document.

post.description: Delete a data attribute. Only admins can delete data attributes.

id.description: Unique identifier for the data attribute.

post.description: Retrieve a document by its `UUID`, `urlId`, or `shareId`. At least one of these parameters must be provided.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

shareId.description: Unique identifier for a document share, a shareId may be used in place of a document UUID

post.summary: Import a file as a document
post.description: This method allows you to create a new document by importing an existing file. By default a document is set to the collection root. If you want to create a nested/child document, you should pass parentDocumentId to set the parent document.

file.description: Plain text, markdown, docx, csv, tsv, and html format are supported.

collectionId.description: Identifier for the collection to import into. One of collectionId or parentDocumentId is required.

parentDocumentId.description: Identifier for the parent document to import under. One of collectionId or parentDocumentId is required.

publish.description: Whether to publish the imported document

post.description: Export a document in Markdown, HTML, or PDF format. The response format is determined by the Accept header. Optionally include child documents in the export as a zip file.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

signedUrls.description: How long signed URLs should remain valid for attachment links (in seconds)

includeChildDocuments.description: Whether to include child documents in the export. Using this option will always return a zip file.

data.description: The document content in Markdown formatting

post.description: This method will list all published documents and draft documents belonging to the current user.

collectionId.description: Optionally filter to a specific collection

userId.description: Optionally filter to documents created by a specific user

statusFilter.description: Document statuses to include in results

post.description: This method returns the nested document structure (tree) for the children of the specified document.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: This method will list all draft documents belonging to the current user.

collectionId.description: A collection to search within

dateFilter.description: Any documents that have not been updated within the specified period will be filtered out

post.description: This method will list all documents recently viewed by the current user.

This method allows asking direct questions of your documents – where possible an answer will be provided. Search results will be restricted to those accessible by the current access token. Note that "AI answers" must be enabled for the workspace.

userId.description: Any documents that have not been edited by the user identifier will be filtered out

collectionId.description: A collection to search within

statusFilter.description: Any documents that are not in the specified status will be filtered out

dateFilter.description: Any documents that have not been updated within the specified period will be filtered out

post.description: This method allows you to search document titles with keywords. Unlike documents.search, this only searches titles and returns faster results.

query.description: Search query to match against document titles

collectionId.description: Filter to a specific collection

documentId.description: Filter results based on content within a document and its children

statusFilter.description: Document statuses to include in results

dateFilter.description: Any documents that have not been updated within the specified period will be filtered out

shareId.description: Filter results for the collection or document referenced by the shareId

sort.description: Specifies the attributes by which search results will be sorted

direction.description: Specifies the sort order with respect to sort field

post.description: This methods allows you to search your workspace's documents with keywords. Note that search results will be restricted to those accessible by the current access token.

userId.description: Any documents that have not been edited by the user identifier will be filtered out

collectionId.description: A collection to search within

statusFilter.description: Document statuses to include in results

dateFilter.description: Any documents that have not been updated within the specified period will be filtered out

shareId.description: Filter results to the collection or document referenced by the shareId

snippetMinWords.description: Minimum number of words to show in search result snippets

snippetMaxWords.description: Maximum number of words to show in search result snippets

sort.description: Specifies the attributes by which search results will be sorted

direction.description: Specifies the sort order with respect to sort field

context.description: A short snippet of context from the document that includes the search query.
context.example: At Acme Inc our hiring practices are inclusive

ranking.description: The ranking used to order search results based on relevance.

post.description: This method allows you to create or publish a new document. By default a document is set to the collection root. If you want to create a nested/child document, you should pass parentDocumentId to set the parent document.

text.description: The body of the document in markdown

icon.description: Icon displayed alongside the document title

color.description: Color for the document icon (hex format)

collectionId.description: Identifier for the collection. Required to publish unless parentDocumentId is provided

parentDocumentId.description: Identifier for the parent document. Required to publish unless collectionId is provided

publish.description: Whether this document should be immediately published and made visible to other workspace members.

fullWidth.description: Whether the document should be displayed in full width

createdAt.description: Optionally set the created date in the past

dataAttributes.description: Data attributes to be included on the document.

dataAttributeId.description: Unique identifier for the data attribute.

value.description: The value of the data attribute. Can be a string, boolean, or number depending on the data attribute type.

post.description: This method allows you to modify an already created document

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

text.description: The body of the document in markdown.

icon.description: Icon displayed alongside the document title

color.description: Color for the document icon (hex format)

fullWidth.description: Whether the document should be displayed in full width

templateId.description: Identifier for the template this document is based on

collectionId.description: Identifier for the collection to move the document to

insightsEnabled.description: Whether insights should be visible on the document

publish.description: Whether this document should be published and made visible to other workspace members, if a draft

dataAttributes.description: Data attributes to be updated. Attributes not included will be removed from the document.

dataAttributeId.description: Unique identifier for the data attribute.

value.description: The value of the data attribute. Can be a string, boolean, or number depending on the data attribute type.

post.summary: Create a template from a document
post.description: This method allows you to create a new template using an existing document as the basis

collectionId.description: Identifier for the collection where the template should be created

publish.description: Whether the new template should be published

post.description: Unpublishing a document moves it back to a draft status and out of the collection.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

detach.description: Whether to detach the document from the collection

post.description: Move a document to a new location or collection. If no parent document is provided, the document will be moved to the collection root.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

index.description: The position index in the collection structure

post.description: Archiving a document allows outdated information to be moved out of sight whilst retaining the ability to optionally search and restore it later.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: If a document has been archived or deleted, it can be restored. Optionally a revision can be passed to restore the document to a previous point in time.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

collectionId.description: Identifier for the collection to restore the document to.

revisionId.description: Identifier for the revision to restore to.

post.description: Deleting a document moves it to the trash. If not restored within 30 days it is permanently deleted.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

permanent.description: If set to true the document will be destroyed with no way to recover rather than moved to the trash.

post.description: All users with access to a document. To list only users with direct membership to the document use `documents.memberships`

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

query.description: If set, will filter the results by user name.

userId.description: If set, will filter the results to a specific user.

post.description: Users with direct membership to a document. To list all users with access to a document use `documents.users`.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

query.description: If set, will filter the results by user name

post.description: This method allows you to add a user membership to the specified document.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: This method allows you to remove a user membership from the specified document.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: This method will list all archived documents belonging to the workspace that the current user has access to.

collectionId.description: Optionally filter to a specific collection

post.description: This method will list all deleted documents belonging to the workspace that the current user has access to.
This method allows you to duplicate an existing document and optionally all of its child documents.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

title.description: New title for the duplicated document

recursive.description: Whether child documents should also be duplicated

publish.description: Whether the new document should be published

collectionId.description: Identifier for the collection the document should be copied to

parentDocumentId.description: Identifier for the parent document the document should be copied to

post.summary: Add a group to a document
post.description: This method allows you to give all members in a group access to a document.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.summary: Remove a group from a document
post.description: This method allows you to revoke all members in a group access to a document.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: This method allows you to list a document's group memberships.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: Permanently delete all documents in the trash. This action is irreversible. Only available to admin users.
Events are an audit trail of important events that happen in the knowledge base.

name.description: Filter to a specific event, e.g. "collections.create". Event names are in the format "objects.verb"

actorId.description: Filter to events performed by the selected user

documentId.description: Filter to events performed in the selected document

collectionId.description: Filter to events performed in the selected collection

auditLog.description: Whether to return detailed events suitable for an audit log. Without this flag less detailed event types will be returned.

post.description: Retrieve the details and current status of a file operation by its unique identifier. File operations represent long-running import or export tasks.

id.description: Unique identifier for the file operation.

post.description: Delete a file operation and its associated files. This is useful for cleaning up completed or failed import/export operations.

id.description: Unique identifier for the file operation.

post.description: Load the resulting file from where it is stored based on the id. A temporary, signed url with embedded credentials is generated on demand.

id.description: Unique identifier for the file operation.

post.description: List all file operations for the current workspace, filtered by type (import or export).
Retrieve the details of a group by its unique identifier, including its name and member count.
List all groups in the workspace. Groups are used to organize users and manage permissions for collections.

userId.description: Filter to groups including a specific user

externalId.description: Filter to groups matching an external ID

query.description: Filter to groups matching a search query

groupMemberships.description: A preview of memberships in the group, note that this is not all memberships which can be queried from `groups.memberships`.

post.description: Create a new group with the specified name. Groups can be used to organize users and assign collection permissions to multiple users at once.
Update an existing group's name. The group is identified by its unique identifier.
Deleting a group will cause all of its members to lose access to any collections the group has previously been added to. This action can’t be undone so please be careful.
List and filter all the members in a group.
This method allows you to add a user to the specified group.

userId.description: Identifier for the user to add to the group

post.description: This method allows you to remove a user from the group.

userId.description: Identifier for the user to remove from the group

post.description: To retrieve information about an OAuth client you must pass either an `id` or a `clientId`.

id.description: Unique identifier for the OAuth client.

clientId.description: Public identifier for the OAuth client.

post.description: List all OAuth clients that the authenticated user has access to. This includes both clients created by the user and published clients available to the workspace.
Create a new OAuth client application that can be used to authenticate users and access the API on their behalf.

description.description: A short description of this OAuth client.
description.example: Integrate Acme Inc's services into Outline.

developerName.description: The name of the developer who created this OAuth client.

developerUrl.description: The URL of the developer who created this OAuth client.

avatarUrl.description: A URL pointing to an image representing the OAuth client.

redirectUris.description: List of redirect URIs for the OAuth client.

published.description: Whether the OAuth client is available to other workspaces.

post.description: Update an existing OAuth client's properties such as name, description, redirect URIs, or published status.

id.description: Unique identifier for the OAuth client.

description.description: A short description of this OAuth client.
description.example: Integrate Acme Inc's services into Outline.

developerName.description: The name of the developer who created this OAuth client.

developerUrl.description: The URL of the developer who created this OAuth client.

avatarUrl.description: A URL pointing to an image representing the OAuth client.

redirectUris.description: List of redirect URIs for the OAuth client.

published.description: Whether the OAuth client is available to other workspaces.

post.summary: Rotate the secret for an OAuth client
post.description: Generate a new client secret for an OAuth client. The old secret will be invalidated immediately, so ensure your application is updated to use the new secret.

id.description: Unique identifier for the OAuth client.

post.description: Permanently delete an OAuth client and revoke all associated access tokens. This action cannot be undone.

id.description: Unique identifier for the OAuth client.

post.description: List all OAuth authentications for the current user. These represent the third-party applications that the user has authorized to access their account.
Revoke an OAuth authentication, removing the third-party application's access to the user's account.
A revision is a snapshot of a document at a specific point in time. This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific version of a document by its unique identifier.
List all revisions for a specific document. Revisions represent historical snapshots of a document's content and can be used to track changes over time.

documentId.description: The document ID to retrieve revisions for

post.description: Retrieve the details of a share link by its unique identifier or by the associated document ID. Shares allow documents to be accessed publicly or by specific users.

documentId.description: Unique identifier for a document. One of id or documentId must be provided.

post.description: List all share links in the workspace.

query.description: Filter to shared documents matching a search query

post.description: Creates a new share link that can be used by to access a document. If you request multiple shares for the same document with the same API key, the same share object will be returned. By default all shares are unpublished.
Allows changing an existing share's published status, which removes authentication and makes it available to anyone with the link.
Makes the share link inactive so that it can no longer be used to access the document.
Stars a document or collection so it appears in the users sidebar. One of either `documentId` or `collectionId` must be provided.
List all starred documents for the authenticated user. Stars allow users to bookmark important documents for quick access in the sidebar.

post.summary: Update a stars order in the sidebar
post.description: Update the position of a starred document in the sidebar. The index parameter determines the display order relative to other starred documents.
Remove a star from a document, removing it from the user's starred documents list in the sidebar.
Send email invitations to one or more users to join the workspace. Invitations include a link to create an account and join the workspace.
Retrieve the details of a user by their unique identifier, including their name, email, avatar, and role within the workspace.
List and filter all the users in the workspace
Update a users name or avatar. If no `id` is passed then the user associated with the authentication will be updated by default.
Change the role of a user, only available to admin authorization.
Suspending a user prevents the user from signing in. Users that are suspended are also not counted against billing totals in the hosted version.
Activating a previously suspended user allows them to signin again. Users that are activated will cause billing totals to be re-calculated in the hosted version.
Deleting a user removes the object entirely. In almost every circumstance it is preferable to suspend a user, as a deleted user can be recreated by signing in with SSO again.
List all users that have viewed a document and the overall view count.

documentId.description: The document ID to retrieve views for

includeSuspended.description: Whether to include views from suspended users

post.description: Creates a new view for a document. This is documented in the interests of thoroughness however it is recommended that views are not created from outside of the Outline UI.
Create a new template that can be used as a starting point for new documents. Templates can optionally be scoped to a specific collection.

id.description: Optionally provide a specific UUID for the template.

data.description: The body of the template as a Prosemirror document.

icon.description: An emoji to use as the template icon.

color.description: The color of the template icon in hex format.

collectionId.description: Identifier for the collection to which the template belongs.

post.description: List all templates available to the current user. Optionally filter by collection. Templates not associated with a collection are workspace-wide.

collectionId.description: Optionally filter to a specific collection

post.description: Retrieve a template by its unique identifier.

id.description: Unique identifier for the template. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: Update an existing template by its unique identifier.

id.description: Unique identifier for the template. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

data.description: The body of the template as a Prosemirror document.

icon.description: An emoji to use as the template icon.

color.description: The color of the template icon in hex format.

fullWidth.description: Whether the template should be displayed full width.

collectionId.description: Identifier for the collection to which the template belongs. Set to null for a workspace-wide template.

post.description: Delete a template by its unique identifier. This will soft-delete the template, it can be restored later.

id.description: Unique identifier for the template. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: Restore a previously deleted template by its unique identifier.

id.description: Unique identifier for the template. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: Create a copy of an existing template. Optionally override the title and target collection.

id.description: Unique identifier for the template to duplicate. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

title.description: Override the title of the duplicated template.

collectionId.description: Identifier for the collection to place the duplicated template in. If not provided, uses the original template's collection.

TextEditMode.description: The editing mode for text updates to a document.

documentId.description: Identifier for the associated document, if any.

urlId.description: A short unique identifier that can be used to identify the collection instead of the UUID.

description.description: A description of the collection, may contain markdown formatting

sort.description: The sort of documents in the collection. Note that not all API responses respect this and it is left as a frontend concern to implement.

index.description: The position of the collection in the sidebar

color.description: A color representing the collection, this is used to help make collections more identifiable in the UI. It should be in HEX format including the #

icon.description: A string that represents an icon in the outline-icons package or an emoji

sharing.description: Whether public document sharing is enabled in this collection

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

deletedAt.description: The date and time that this object was deleted

archivedAt.description: The date and time that this object was archived

data.description: The editor data representing this comment.

documentId.description: Identifier for the document this is related to.

parentCommentId.description: Identifier for the comment this is a child of, if any.

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

anchorText.description: The document text that the comment is anchored to, only included if includeAnchorText=true.

name.description: The name of this data attribute.

description.description: A description of the data attribute.
description.example: The current status of the document.

pinned.description: Whether this data attribute is pinned to the top of documents.

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

deletedAt.description: The date and time that this object was deleted

DataAttributeDataType.description: The data type of the attribute value.

DataAttributeOptions.description: Additional options for certain data attribute types.

icon.description: An icon representing the data attribute from the outline-icons package.

options.description: Valid options for list data type.

dataAttributeId.description: Unique identifier for the associated data attribute.

value.description: The value of the data attribute for this document.

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object attribute was last changed

collectionId.description: Identifier for the associated collection.

parentDocumentId.description: Identifier for the document this is a child of, if any.

fullWidth.description: Whether this document should be displayed in a full-width view.

emoji.description: An emoji associated with the document.

text.description: The text content of the document, contains markdown formatting

urlId.description: A short unique ID that can be used to identify the document as an alternative to the UUID

pinned.description: Whether this document is pinned in the collection

templateId.description: Unique identifier for the template this document was created from, if any

revision.description: A number that is auto incrementing with every revision of the document that is saved

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

publishedAt.description: The date and time that this object was published

archivedAt.description: The date and time that this object was archived

deletedAt.description: The date and time that this object was deleted

modelId.description: Identifier for the object this event is associated with when it is not one of document, collection, or user.

actorId.description: The user that performed the action.

actorIpAddress.description: The ip address the action was performed from. This field is only returned when the `auditLog` boolean is true.

collectionId.description: Identifier for the associated collection, if any

documentId.description: Identifier for the associated document, if any

createdAt.description: The date and time that this event was created

data.description: Additional unstructured data associated with the event

state.description: The state of the file operation.

size.description: The size of the resulting file in bytes

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

memberCount.description: The number of users that are members of the group

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

name.description: The name of this OAuth client.

description.description: A short description of this OAuth client.
description.example: Integrate Acme Inc's services into Outline.

developerName.description: The name of the developer who created this OAuth client.

developerUrl.description: The URL of the developer who created this OAuth client.

avatarUrl.description: A URL pointing to an image representing the OAuth client.

clientId.description: The client ID for the OAuth client.

clientSecret.description: The client secret for the OAuth client.

redirectUris.description: The redirect URIs for the OAuth client.

published.description: Whether the OAuth client is available to other workspaces.

createdAt.description: Date and time when this OAuth client was created

updatedAt.description: Date and time when this OAuth client was updated

lastActiveAt.description: Date and time when this authentication was last used

text.description: Body of the document, may contain markdown formatting

createdAt.description: Date and time when this revision was created

url.description: URL of the publicly shared document.

published.description: If true the share can be loaded without a user account.

includeChildDocuments.description: If to also give permission to view documents nested beneath this one.

createdAt.description: Date and time when this share was created

updatedAt.description: Date and time when this share was edited

lastAccessedAt.description: Date and time when this share was last viewed

index.description: Index of the star in the list of stars.

documentId.description: Unique identifier for the starred document.

collectionId.description: Unique identifier for the starred collection.

createdAt.description: Date and time when this star was created

name.description: The name of this workspace, it is usually auto-generated when the first SSO connection is made but can be changed if necessary.

avatarUrl.description: The URL for the image associated with this workspace, it will be displayed in the workspace switcher and in the top left of the knowledge base along with the name.

sharing.description: Whether this workspace has share links globally enabled. If this value is false then all sharing UI and APIs are disabled.

defaultCollectionId.description: If set then the referenced collection is where users will be redirected to after signing in instead of the Home screen

memberCollectionCreate.description: Whether members are allowed to create new collections. If false then only admins can create collections.

documentEmbeds.description: Whether this workspace has embeds in documents globally enabled. It can be disabled to reduce potential data leakage to third parties.

collaborativeEditing.description: Whether this workspace has collaborative editing in documents globally enabled.

inviteRequired.description: Whether an invite is required to join this workspace, if false users may join with a linked SSO provider.

items.description: A hostname that user emails are restricted to

guestSignin.description: Whether this workspace has guest signin enabled. Guests can signin with an email address and are not required to have a Google Workspace/Slack SSO account once invited.

subdomain.description: Represents the subdomain at which this workspace's knowledge base can be accessed.

url.description: The fully qualified URL at which this workspace's knowledge base can be accessed.

name.description: The name of this user, it is migrated from Slack or Google Workspace when the SSO connection is made but can be changed if necessary.

avatarUrl.description: The URL for the image associated with this user, it will be displayed in the application UI and email notifications.

email.description: The email associated with this user, it is migrated from Slack or Google Workspace when the SSO connection is made but can be changed if necessary.

isSuspended.description: Whether this user has been suspended.

lastActiveAt.description: The last time this user made an API request, this value is updated at most every 5 minutes.

createdAt.description: The date and time that this user first signed in or was invited as a guest.

name.description: The full name of the user being invited

collectionId.description: Identifier for the associated collection.

answer.description: An answer to the query, if possible
answer.example: Our hiring policy can be summarized as…

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

id.description: Unique identifier for the object this policy references.

abilities.description: The abilities that are allowed by this policy, if an array is returned then the individual ID's in the array represent the memberships that grant the ability.

Ability.description: A single permission granted by a policy

collectionId.description: Identifier for the associated collection.

url.description: A URL path to access the template.

urlId.description: A short unique identifier for the template used in URLs.

data.description: The body of the template as a Prosemirror document.

icon.description: An emoji to use as the template icon.

color.description: The color of the template icon in hex format.

fullWidth.description: Whether the template should be displayed full width.

collectionId.description: Identifier for the associated collection, if any.

createdAt.description: The date and time that the template was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time that the template was last changed.

deletedAt.description: The date and time that the template was deleted.

publishedAt.description: The date and time that the template was published.

firstViewedAt.description: When the document was first viewed by the user

lastViewedAt.description: When the document was last viewed by the user

count.description: The number of times the user has viewed the document.

NotFound.description: The specified resource was not found.

Validation.description: The request failed one or more validations.

Unauthorized.description: The current API key is not authorized to perform this action.

Unauthenticated.description: The API key is missing or otherwise invalid.

Retry-After.description: Seconds in the future to retry the request, if rate limited.

RateLimit-Limit.description: The maximum requests available in the current duration.

RateLimit-Remaining.description: How many requests are left in the current duration.

RateLimit-Reset.description: Timestamp in the future the duration will reset.
